This doc says:

must-revalidate =97 tells caches that they must obey=
 any freshness  
information you give them about a representation. HTTP all=
ows caches  
to serve stale representations under special conditions; by  
=
specifying this header, you=92re telling the cache that you want it to  
st=
rictly follow your rules.

Could someone enlighten me, or point me to such =
enlightenment, what  
the special conditions are that a cache could serve s=
tale data, and  
why I'd want to say must-revalidate to prevent this? Also,=
 when might  
I want to say proxy-revalidate instead?

Thanks.
